title: P.M. Update: Winds crank up this evening, and they’re even stronger on a blustery Thursday
text:
The colors are showing up in West Virginia on this rainy day. (John Ernst/Flickr)

It has been awhile since we’ve had a good soaking rain like we saw today. Most spots picked up over an inch, and Washington was close to a daily record with 1.35 inches. While it’s not my favorite kind of weather, I was willing to give this one a pass. What some might call even less friendly weather is on the way, as a chilly wind picks up tonight and keeps on going tomorrow. At least the sun returns!

Listen to our daily D.C. forecasts: Apple Podcasts | Amazon Echo | More options

Through tonight: Rain is off to the northeast, save for a couple of showers, and the main story into the night is wind. Skies are trending clearer as winds pick up out of the northwest, around 20 to 25 mph, through the evening. They may diminish a bit later, but they will continue. Some gusts past 30 or 35 mph seem likely. Winds decrease somewhat in the predawn hours, but not for long.

View the current weather at The Washington Post.

Tomorrow (Thursday): Despite a lot of sun, it will feel as if we jumped ahead a few weeks on the calendar. Winds will crank back up once the sun rises, and it will stay gusty through the day. We’re talking sustained winds around 20 to 30 mph, plus gusts as high as 40 or 45 mph. There’s a wind advisory up for the Blue Ridge, and that could ultimately be extended to other areas. High temperatures will be mainly in the mid-50s to near 60.

See Dan Stillman’s forecast through the weekend. And if you haven’t already, join us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. For related traffic news, check out Gridlock.

Snow! Some spots in West Virginia’s highlands may see their first accumulating snow tonight into early tomorrow. It won’t be a lot, but it’s another sign of the season. This snow potential is pretty normal, with average first accumulation (0.1 inches or greater) coming around Oct. 5-10 in the region. Up at Snowshoe, it’s already 35 degrees late this afternoon. You might want to check the webcams there tonight!



Some snow is possible in the mountains tonight.

description: Gusts past 40 mph are likely tomorrow. It will make highs in the 50s to near 60 feel even chillier.
